thread.title: Coral Springs' Torgashev, 15, finishes 11th at U.S. Figure Skating Championships
thread.title_full: Coral Springs' Torgashev, 15, finishes 11th at U.S. Figure Skating Championships

author: Gary Curreri
title: Coral Springs' Torgashev, 15, finishes 11th at U.S. Figure Skating Championships

organizations.name: jamie squire / getty images  coral springs

text:
Coral Springs' Torgashev, 15, finishes 11th at U.S. Figure Skating Championships 2017 U.S. Figure Skating Championships - Day 4 Jamie Squire / Getty Images 
Coral Springs 15-year-old Andrew Torgashev competes in the Men's Free Skate program during the 2017 U.S. Figure Skating Championships at the Sprint Center on January 22, 2017 in Kansas City, Missouri. (Photo by Jamie Squire/Getty Images) ** OUTS - ELSENT, FPG, CM - OUTS * NM, PH, VA if sourced by CT, LA or MoD ** 
Coral Springs 15-year-old Andrew Torgashev competes in the Men's Free Skate program during the 2017 U.S. Figure Skating Championships at the Sprint Center on January 22, 2017 in Kansas City, Missouri. (Photo by Jamie Squire/Getty Images) ** OUTS - ELSENT, FPG, CM - OUTS * NM, PH, VA if sourced by CT, LA or MoD ** (Jamie Squire / Getty Images) Privacy Policy 
Nathan Chen delivered five quads in his program in a record-breaking performance to become the youngest U.S. figure skating men's champion in more than five decades. 
The 17-year-old Salt Lake City native was the leader after the short program with 106.39 points and added a 212.08 in the free skate to finish with a 318.47 total in winning the US championship at the 2017 Prudential U.S. Figure Skating Championships at the Sprint Center in Kansas City, Missouri. Scott Allen won the title at age 16 back in 1966. 
Coral Springs' Andrew Torgashev, who at 15 was the youngest skater in this year's Senior Men's competition, started in seventh place after the short program and finished 11th overall. His score of 225.35 was just eight points out of sixth place. 
"I was just happy to get the programs out there," said Torgashev, the 2015 U.S. Junior Men's Champion who was making his debut in the Senior Men's championship. "They weren't perfect, but that means there is room to grow." 
Based on his performance at the event, Torgashev was selected to compete at the 2017 Junior World Championships from March 15-19 in Chinese Taipei. 
His personal best entering the free skate was 139.44, but he skated to Queen's Bohemian Rhapsody and finished with a 147.53 for 225.35 total. He is a member of the Panthers Figure Skating Club in Coral Springs and sophomore at North Broward Prep. 
Torgashev had fallen in his short program doing a quad toe loop, however that was not the case on Sunday. It was the first time he landed a quad in a competition. 
"The atmosphere was way different than any other nationals that I have ever done," he said. "There was TV crews everywhere and skaters that I have been looking up to for a long time. It was great to skate along side of them and compete against them. I was so happy to land my quad." 
Another Panthers Figure Skating Club member, Franchesca Chiera, 19, also of Coral Springs, was in 13th after the short program in the Senior Ladies and scored 104.44 late Saturday for a 158.41 total, which was good enough for 15th place. It was her fourth appearance at nationals. 
"I definitely had a moment in the free skate," Chiera said. "I could have had a better short (program), but I felt happy with how I skated. I think I showed I am capable and belonged there."
